definition: to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: And the cloud of the LORD was upon them by day, when they went out of the camp.
sentences.chinese: 他們拔營往前行，日間有耶和華的雲彩在他們以上。

sentences.english: We struck camp at dawn to make an early start on the next part of our journey.
sentences.chinese: 我們黎明時拔營以便一早出發趕上一段路程。

sentences.english: So Sennacherib, king of Assyria, departed, returned home and lived in Nineveh.
sentences.chinese: 亞述王散乃黑黎佈於是拔營，起程回國，住在尼尼微。

sentences.english: Sometimes, you pull up stakes and go home.
So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.
sentences.chinese: 亞述王西拿基立，就拔營回去，住在尼尼微。

sentences.english: They broke camp, and took up their line of march before daybreak.
sentences.chinese: 他們在黎明前拔營，進入行軍隊列。
